tool.name: GDAL Informations
tool.description: lists information about a raster dataset
tool.command: gdalinfo '$input1' #if $settings.advanced=='advanced' $settings.mm $settings.stats $settings.approx_stats $settings.hist $settings.nogcp $settings.nomd $settings.norat $settings.noct $settings.checksum $settings.listmdd $settings.proj4 -mdd '$settings.mdd' #end if #if $format.value=='json' -json > '$outputJson'; #if $subdataset=='subd_y' cat '$outputJson' | grep -A 1 "\"SUBDATASET_._NAME\":\".*\"," | cut -d "\"" -f4- | sed 's/..$//' | sed 's/\t//' | sed -e 'N; s/\n/\t/' > Subdatasets.tabular #end if #else > '$outputDefault'; #if $subdataset=='subd_y' cat '$outputDefault' | grep -A 1 "SUBDATASET_._NAME=.*:.*$" | cut -d "=" -f 2 | sed 's/\t//' | sed -e 'N; s/\n/\t/' > Subdatasets.tabular #end if #end if

param.name: input1
param.label: Gdal supported raster input file
param.help: Currently supported format are GTiff,VRT and netCDF.

param.name: subdataset
param.label: Create list of potential subdatasets
param.help: If set to yes, a tabular file will be created with a list of all subdatasets. Use this to later perform actions on custom subdata with gdal tranlsate.

param.name: mm
param.label: Force computation of the actual min/max values for each band in the dataset.

param.name: approx_stats
param.help: -approx_stats. However, they may be computed based on overviews or a subset of all tiles. Useful if you are in a hurry and don't want precise stats.
param.label: Read and display image statistics.

param.name: hist
param.label: Report histogram information for all bands.

param.name: nogcp
param.label: Suppress ground control points list printing.

param.name: nomd
param.help: -nomd. Some datasets may contain a lot of metadata strings
param.label: Suppress metadata printing.

param.name: checksum
param.label: Force computation of the checksum for each band in the dataset.

param.name: listmdd
param.label: List all metadata domains available for the dataset.

param.name: proj4
param.help: -proj4 String corresponding to the file's coordinate system
param.label: Report a PROJ.4 string.

param.name: mdd
param.label: Report metadata for the specified domain.

validator.message: mdd option can't be an empty value

tool.help:
========================== Gdalinfo ========================== **What it does**
The gdalinfo program lists various information about a GDAL supported raster dataset.
It will report all of the following (if known):
- The format driver used to access the file. - Raster size (in pixels and lines). - The coordinate system for the file (in OGC WKT). - The geotransform associated with the file (rotational coefficients are currently not reported). - Corner coordinates in georeferenced, and if possible lat/long based on the full geotransform (but not GCPs). - Ground control points. - File wide (including subdatasets) metadata. - Band data types. - Band color interpretations. - Band block size. - Band descriptions. - Band min/max values (internally known and possibly computed). - Band checksum (if computation asked). - Band NODATA value. - Band overview resolutions available. - Band unit type (i.e.. "meters" or "feet" for elevation bands). - Band pseudo-color tables.
|
**How to use it**
Select from history a suported raster file and choose either Json or Text format for result display.
An additional option can list available subdatasets.
|
**Advanced options and sources**
To see complete details and help section please check the official gdal sources.
http://www.gdal.org
http://www.gdal.org/gdalinfo.html
Raster Processing Tutorial : https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/UserDocs/RasterProcTutorial
